item.title: 里夫斯将从英国通胀困境中获得难得的预算支持
item.description: 在剩下不到两个月的时间里，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将从一个不太可能的方面获得帮助：通货膨胀。【原文：With less than two months left to finalize her plans for patching up the UK’s multi-billion-pound budgetary black hole, Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is set to get help from an unlikely quarter: inflation.】

item.title: 爱尔兰将发布投资预算应对特朗普威胁
item.description: 爱尔兰政府将公布多年来最严厉的预算，以保护本国经济免受美国公司投资下降的威胁。【原文：The Irish government is to deliver its toughest budget in years in a bid to shield its economy from the threat of declining investment from US firms.】

item.title: 据《金融时报》报道，埃隆-马斯克任命前摩根士丹利银行家为 xAI 首席财务官
item.description: 据《金融时报》报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）任命摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）前高管担任 xAI 首席财务官，任命这位盟友帮助监管美国最大的人工智能初创公司之一。【原文：Elon Musk named a former Morgan Stanley executive the chief financial officer of xAI, the Financial Times reported, appointing an ally to help oversee one of the largest US artificial intelligence startups.】

item.title: 日本 30 年期国债销售需求低于 12 个月平均水平
item.description: 日本 30 年期国债拍卖的需求率高于 12 个月的平均水平，缓解了投资者对支持刺激政策的保守派人士佐奈隆一在执政党领导人竞选中意外胜出的担忧。【原文：Japan’s 30-year government bond auction drew a stronger demand ratio than its 12-month average, easing investor concerns following the surprise victory of pro-stimulus conservative Sanae Takaichi in the ruling party leadership race.】

item.title: 股票交易员关注 LG 印度、塔塔资本首次公开募股和 Nifty 指数突破
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 高市任命日本前财务大臣为自民党秘书长
item.description: 有望成为日本首位女首相的高市真奈任命前财务大臣铃木俊一为执政党新秘书长，这表明她的目标是平息人们对财政纪律的担忧。【原文：Sanae Takaichi, who is expected to be Japan’s first female prime minister, appointed former Finance Minister Shunichi Suzuki as the ruling party’s new Secretary-General in a sign that she aims to quell concerns about fiscal discipline.】

item.title: 铜走高，关注美联储利率和美国停摆
item.description: 在美国政府关门之际，投资者关注美联储利率前景，铜价因此上涨。【原文：Copper rose as investors focused on the outlook for Federal Reserve interest rates amid a US government shutdown.】

item.title: LG 电子印度公司开始接受 13 亿美元首次公开募股订单
item.description: LG电子公司的印度分公司将开始接受13亿美元首次公开募股的订单，与塔塔资本有限公司（Tata Capital Ltd.）一起启动交易，这可能是印度新股上市创纪录的一个月。【原文：LG Electronics Inc.’s Indian unit is set to start taking orders for its $1.3 billion initial public offering, joining Tata Capital Ltd. to launch deals in what could be a record month for new listings in the country.】

item.title: 菲律宾通胀率保持在目标之下，为降息提供了空间
item.description: 菲律宾的通货膨胀在 9 月份有所加快，但仍低于中央银行的目标范围，这为货币当局在今年进一步降低基准利率提供了空间。【原文：Philippine inflation quickened in September but stayed below the central bank’s target range, giving monetary authorities space to reduce the benchmark interest rate further this year.】

item.title: 高市冲击市场后，日元套利交易重回视野
item.description: 由于佐佐江-高市几乎确定升任日本首相，加息步伐放缓的可能性增大，一度流行的押注日元的货币交易似乎将卷土重来。【原文：A once-popular currency trade betting against the yen looks set to make a comeback, as Sanae Takaichi’s near-certain elevation to Japan’s premiership raises the prospect of slower interest-rate hikes.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦央行称进一步降息取决于国际货币基金组织（IMF）的审查结果
item.description: 巴基斯坦央行行长认为，尽管进一步降息将取决于近期毁灭性洪灾的影响和国际货币基金组织正在进行的审查结果，但通货膨胀率仍将保持稳定。【原文：Pakistan’s central bank governor sees inflation holding steady, although further interest-rate cuts will depend on the impact of the recent devastating floods and the outcome of an ongoing International Monetary Fund review.】

item.title: Qualtrics 同意以 67.5 亿美元收购 Press Ganey Forsta
item.description: Qualtrics International 公司同意收购医疗保健调查公司 Press Ganey Forsta，交易价值 67.5 亿美元，这是私募股权投资驱动的最新一次企业软件业务收购。【原文：Qualtrics International Inc. agreed to buy health-care survey firm Press Ganey Forsta in a deal valued at $6.75 billion, in the latest private equity-driven acquisition of an enterprise software business.】

item.title: 日本 8 月家庭支出增幅超过预期
item.description: 日本家庭支出连续第四个月增长，在通胀持续的情况下显示出韧性，而日本央行仍在考虑下一次加息的时机。【原文：Japan’s household spending rose for a fourth month, showing resilience amid persistent inflation as the central bank continues to mull the timing of its next interest rate hike.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 10 月消费者信心指数降至六个月低点
item.description: 澳大利亚消费者信心指数本月下滑至六个月来的最低点，原因是近期通胀强劲，人们对未来降息的希望再次产生怀疑。【原文：Australia’s consumer confidence slipped to a six-month low this month on renewed doubts about hopes of future interest rate cuts given recent strength in inflation.】

item.title: 澳大利亚两家养老金公司确认合并成立 1560 亿澳元基金
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老金公司之一 Aware Super 确认计划与规模较小的竞争对手 TelstraSuper 合并，成立一个规模达 2,350 亿澳元（1,560 亿美元）的基金。【原文：Aware Super, one of Australia’s largest pensions, confirmed plans to merge with smaller rival TelstraSuper to form a A$235 billion ($156 billion) fund.】

item.title: 欧佩克+供应决定成关注焦点，原油在上涨后趋于平稳
item.description: 在欧佩克+同意小幅增加供应配额后，石油价格在连续两天上涨后趋于稳定，交易商也在分析沙特价格低于预期的信号。【原文：Oil steadied after a two-day advance after OPEC+ agreed on a modest supply quota increase, with traders also parsing signals from lower-than-expected Saudi prices.】

item.title: Vinci Compass 收购 Stuhlberger's Verde 的控股权
item.description: Vinci Compass Investments Ltd. 正在收购巴西资产管理公司 Verde Asset Management 的控股权，该公司是路易斯-斯图尔伯格（Luis Stuhlberger）近三十年前发起的 Verde 基金的母公司。【原文：Vinci Compass Investments Ltd. is acquiring a controlling stake in Verde Asset Management, the Brazilian asset manager home to the Verde fund launched by Luis Stuhlberger almost three decades ago, in a deal that underscores shifting dynamics across the local hedge fund industry.】

item.title: 斯塔默率商业代表团访问印度，宣传英国贸易协定
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）将率领一个由 100 多名英国商界、学术界和文化界领袖组成的代表团访问印度，在签署了期待已久的自由贸易协定之后，他将努力深化两国之间的贸易往来。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer will lead a delegation of more than 100 British business, academic and cultural leaders to India, as he seeks to deepen commerce between the two countries after signing a long-awaited free trade agreement.】

item.title: 马来西亚 2026 年预算计划交易指南
item.description: 马来西亚总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣（Anwar Ibrahim）准备公布明年的国家支出计划，投资者希望看到在财政审慎和面对美国关税时支持贸易依赖型经济的需要之间取得平衡。【原文：As Malaysia’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim prepares to unveil the nation’s spending plan for next year, investors are keen to see a balance between fiscal prudence and the need to support the trade-reliant economy in the face of US tariffs.】

item.title: 美国关门刺激避险需求，黄金逼近4000美元
item.description: 美国政府停摆为美联储在本月晚些时候召开政策制定者会议之前的加息路径增添了另一层不确定性，黄金创下新纪录，逼近每盎司 4,000 美元。【原文：Gold clinched a fresh record — pushing closer to $4,000 an ounce — as the US government shutdown added another layer of uncertainty over the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate path before a gathering of policymakers later this month.】

item.title: 日本面临高风险债券销售，高市获胜引发市场震荡

item.title: 新西兰企业前景黯淡加剧衰退风险
item.description: 新西兰企业在第三季度不太乐观，这增加了经济再次衰退和央行进一步降息的风险。【原文：New Zealand businesses were less optimistic in the third quarter, raising the risk of another recession and deeper interest-rate cuts from the central bank.】

item.title: Cboe 获准在澳大利亚上市，威胁竞争对手 ASX
